intro: Dicliptera bagshawei, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats and has a sprawling growth habit. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Dicliptera bagshawei is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
